intro: Anomospermum hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy anomospermum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Olacaceae. It is native to the dry regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, which is often covered in a dense layer of white, hairy foliage. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. Anomospermum hirsutum is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils.
